post_text:
Important Notice:
In an abundance of precaution, we will NOT be distributing Chromebooks at Hill Center this evening. Students WILL be able to work on their courses. New guidelines are being implemented to transition from Central Office facilitating your studies to Hill Center staff. Please be patient as we figure out the logistics. Check REMIND and Facebook often as we will use these platforms to push information out.

Visit www.mymec.org/students for instructions on how to work on your courses. If you have questions or concerns, you may reach out to one of your site admin (patti.mullinax@mymec.org or frank.gordy@mymec.org). We recommend that everyone follow safe practice guidelines!

post_text:
Change in Site Opening Schedule

All MECHS sites are closed the week of August 3-7 for summer break. Fall Semester will begin on 8/10/20 at Hill Center-MECHS with virtual learning only. In our last announcement, we stated that the site would open on 8/17. The date for returning for on-site learning activities has been revised to 9/14/20. We will continue to inform you of any changes to the schedule. Thank you!

post_text: Summer session at Hill Center MECHS ends on Thursday, 7/30/20. Under the current plan, Fall Semester begins on Monday 8/10/20. We will be supporting students (online only) from Monday 8/10/20 through Thursday 8/13/20. Beginning 8/17/20 we will be learning on site -Mondays through Wednesdays. Thursdays will be virtual learning only. Beginning 8/10/20 hours will return to our normal 4:30pm - 9 pm. If there are updates, we will keep you informed. Thank you!

Thursdays will be virtual learning only. Beginning 8/10/20 hours will return to our normal 4:30pm - 9 pm. If there are updates, we will keep you informed. Thank you!

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 12 at 9:27 AM ·

Emily Torres is a Class of 2020 graduate from the Hill Center Site. Emily is also the recipient of a $5,000 scholarship. Her future plans are to study hard and get good grades in order to get into the Radiology Program at Lanier Tech. Emily's favorite memory at MECHS was trivia night and decorating cookies and ornaments at the December family night. Emily says, "The teachers in the peak room are very special to me, they encouraged me and motivated me when times were difficult. They even sent me a card in the mail when I started college. This simple action showed they cared for me and my future." Emily also enjoyed the non-traditional learning environment at MECHS while having her own independence and making her own decisions. Emily says, "I decided when I would go to school and how long I would be there. I set my own pace. I felt as I was taking control of my future." Congratulations Emily! We are so proud of your hard work. #classof2020 #graduation2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad ##highschoolgraduation #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Monday, June 8 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag, you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

post_text:
Welcome! Join us at 5:00 pm as our Family Engagement Liaison Justin Hodges reviews how MEC Hill Center is using our Title I funds to best help our students and here your questions, comments, and suggestions for making MEC the best high school experience around!

You can find links to all of the documents mentioned in this presentation at the following URL: https://tinyurl.com/MECTitle1

And here is a link to our Needs Assessment survey to fill out after the video: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfkX8LHF1mtUA9vq0co79yKjoYXxjIgTyXm2IZMTzWsemLSQw/viewform

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 1:38 PM ·

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

post_text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

post_text: We concluded our 6th Student Appreciation Night and our 3rd and final night of Career Expo with yet more impressive guests. We were blessed to have: City of Cumming Mayor-Troy Brumbalow, Home Hospice Nurse- Andrew Rodriguez, Jennifer Williams- Lanier Tech Oakwood, Cody Phillips PTA- Benchmark Physical Therapy, and Ben Cox- Electrician. Thanks to all for giving of your time to our students.

post_text: Students @ The Hill: We are halfway through our days of celebrating you, but still, some of you have not given us that opportunity. It’s a great night to come on back! Tonight is the last night of our career Expo (which had been AMAZING!) and we are having salad and pizza from Georgio's for dinner. There will be giveaways and all sorts of awesome stuff happening.

post_text: Night #2 of our Career Expo was awesome. The House was packed! We had Sgt. Copley, Sgt. Gastelum, and Sgt. Morgan of the USMC. Jacob Watson, Colby Padgett, andTyler Womack from Innovative Plumbing. Rita Willis talked about educational opportunities at Lanier Tech and Danielle Walls explained what it takes to be a real estate agent. Thanks to all for sharing with our students last night!

Rita Willis talked about educational opportunities at Lanier Tech and Danielle Walls explained what it takes to be a real estate agent. Thanks to all for sharing with our students last night!

post_text: Night #5 of Student Appreciation is here. Come on in students. Professionals from the fields of nursing, interior design, and real estate @ The Hill Tonight. Wings 101 for dinner. Timothy Williams of the Army National Guard.

post_text: Students @ The Hill: Tonight begins our 3-day career expo! As requested last semester, we have worked hard to find professionals in the areas of Cosmetology, Electrical, Real Estate, Nursing, etc. Each night, we will have 5 guests introduce themselves before dinner and then stay to answer questions about the careers that you are interested in. If you haven't already attended during our Student Appreciation Days, tonight would be a GREAT night to come! See you tonight!

post_text: Students and parents of Juniors and Seniors, Join MEC Hill Center tonight at 6:30 for "NACHO Typical Path to Graduation." Hill Center team members will help students navigate their paths to graduation by leading an information session outlining grad requirements, available programs, and scholarship opportunities. The information session will be followed a delicious nacho bar dinner.

The information session will be followed a delicious nacho bar dinner.

post_text: Hello Awesome Students! Happening tonight: Movie Night @ The Hill, part 3. I look forward to kicking back and watching tonight's movie with you! Popcorn and drinks for all. Dinner served at the normal time. Take a break to watch all or part of the movie! We're having Publix sub sandwiches, chips and cookies. I can't wait to see and celebrate you! - Ms. Austin, Attendance Coordinator

post_text: Parents, please Join us to learn more about our Title I program at 6:30 pm tonight. The meeting is from 6:30 to 7:00 to be followed by a meal with students, their families, and the Hill Center Staff. The meal is being prepared by one of our meal program partners and local favorite, Giorgio’s Restaurant. It is sure to be good! See you at The Hill!

post_text: Summer is the time when flowers bloom ...it is also a great time for your dreams to blossom by getting back to work on earning your high school diploma. Come by and talk with us this summer about enrolling. Since our courses are self-paced, you can enroll at any time. We are currently in session Monday- Thursday 4-8 pm.
text: Summer is the time when flowers bloom ...it is also a great time for your dreams to blossom by getting back to work on earning your high school diploma. Come by and talk with us this summer about enrolling. Since our courses are self-paced, you can enroll at any time. We are currently in session Monday- Thursday 4-8 pm.

post_text: We start our summer session hours today- 4:00pm-8:00pm, Monday- Thursday. Summer is a great opportunity to finish a few courses and capitalize on the progress you have made during the year. See you this afternoon, students!

post_text: Tonight at Mountain Education Hill Center, students are provided an opportunity to meet with several colleges and explore future dual enrollment options, all while being a MECHS student! A special thanks to University of North Georgia, Lanier, and Georgia Military College for providing exciting options for all!

post_text: Great night of work, food, fun, and prizes on the first day of Student Appreciation Days at MEC Hill Center. This is only the beginning. Students, whatever you do, don’t miss Monday!
text: Great night of work, food, fun, and prizes on the first day of Student Appreciation Days at MEC Hill Center. This is only the beginning. Students, whatever you do, don’t miss Monday!

post_text: Student Appreciation Days begin tonight! Our theme tonight is from Stephen Covey’s 7 Habits - “Begin With The End in Mind!” Day by day and module by module, you will get there, students! Visualize being on the stage in your MEC green cap and gown receiving your diploma! Take the next step to getting there- put in the work tonight!
text: Student Appreciation Days begin tonight! Our theme tonight is from Stephen Covey’s 7 Habits - “Begin With The End in Mind!” Day by day and module by module, you will get there, students! post_text: Thanks to The Station House Restaurant, Giorgio’s Restaurant, Walmart Deli, Dickey’s Pit Barbeque, and Zaxby’s for partnering with us recently to provide meals for our students. In an unofficial poll, all of these got 100% thumbs up from our students. Parents, if you are in the area, please stop by and tell them how much we appreciate them!

post_text: We open @ 6 pm tonight to students, so our staff can work on professional learning - in order to better serve our students. We have a new and exciting treat for diner tonight, though! No more hints.

post_text: Students, who led the way in number of courses in the month of August completed, received prizes at our awards meeting last Thursday! Congratulations to: Marcus P., Arturo T., Ismael C., Tyler S., and Tiffany T. Way to set the pace students!

post_text: Our winner in the Attend to Achieve drawing for August was Alex K. (Sorry not pictured). The prize was two tickets to the UGA VS MTSU football game! Congratulations Alex! Students got a ticket for ever day they attended and an extra ticket for every hour they were here working during the month of August.
